intro: Crotalaria subcapitata subsp. oreadum, commonly known as the mountain crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, showcasing adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with distinctive papilionaceous petals, and it produces small, pod-like fruits containing several seeds. This subspecies is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
